newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan's Dewan Salman jumps 8.98 pct.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan's Dewan Salman jumps 8.98 pct.

text.p: Pakistan's Dewan Salman Fibre rose 3.60 rupees, or 8.98 percent, to 43.70 on Monday on speculative buying driven by hopes that domestic fibre prices would rise in line with international prices, dealers said.
A turnover of more than 7.5 million shares of Dewan Salam was recorded in early trade on the Karachi Stock Exchange.
"It is basically speculative buying on hopes that local synthetic prices would be raised following a slight increase in its international rates," said dealer Ather Raouf.
Raouf said Dewan was a volatile stock and a favourite among speculators. -- Karachi newsroom 9221-5685192
